page.title: 06FORESTRY _ CONTD
page.content: The foresters try to protect their young plantation by wire but smaller animals ofcourse can still cause problems. Although there are few hares, they do untold damage by cutting the leading shoots of the trees _ comically leaving them uneaten. Woodvoles chew at the bark in winter. There are two sales per year. Trees are sold in bulk. The main buyer being Gordons of Fraserburgh although sawmills locally are supplied, especially those at Longside. The produce is used for pulp and exported to Scandinavia. The Forestry Commision in this area is staffed by six men, five of whom are permanent, but there are many men on site, felling under contract supplying up to twenty men and lorries.
